summary: Gyeongnam Governor Park Wan-soo expressed gratitude to overseas compatriots for their donations to wildfire-affected regions during a homecoming event.
Environmental groups face criticism for opposing flood and wildfire prevention measures like river dredging and forest road construction.
Record-breaking wildfires in March 2025 across Gyeongsang regions were finally contained by rainfall after spreading rapidly due to dry conditions and strong winds.
Korean rescue teams documented 10-hour operations with international cooperation after the Myanmar earthquake disaster.
Gyeongbuk Governor Lee Chul-woo proposed rebuilding wildfire-ravaged areas as tourism complexes rather than reforestation.
